intro: Oldenlandia diffusa, commonly known as the "slipper vine," is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Oldenlandia diffusa is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
